items.title: Pidilite Industries shares gain over 3% on strong Q4 results
items.description: Pidilite Industries posted an 8% year-on-year increase in consolidated revenue for the March quarter

items.title: Pakistan stock market surges 9% on India-Pak ceasefire, IMF bailout; trading halted for 1 hour
items.description: Amid heightened tensions, Pakistan was granted a bail-out package of $2.3 billion by the International Monetary Fund (IMF)

items.title: Chart of the Day: Investors have again fallen into timing the market trap
items.description: Equity inflows dropped in April. But the real problem is that retail investors still believe they can outsmart the market

items.title: Dr Reddy's shares rise marginally as Q4 net profit jumps 22%; brokerages give mixed views
items.description: Brokerages' mixed review on Dr Reddy's higher than estimated earnings performance; cautiousness suggests recalibration of near-term expectations

items.title: Swiggy Q4 FY25: Growth on the table, Quick Commerce remains a drag
items.description: The company continues to deliver strong top-line growth, but continued investment in Quick Commerce and rising competitive intensity are weighing on margins.

items.title: SBI-Sumitomo deal for Yes Bank – Who gains the most?
items.description: The deal makes the bank a winner

items.title: Nifty Pharma recovers, Asian drugmakers shares tumble as Trump to slash US drug prices
items.description: Indian pharmaceutical stocks fell sharply after U.S. President Donald Trump announced a push to lower domestic drug prices between 30 to 80 percent.

items.title: Yes Bank shares rise 9% on open as Japan's SMBC to acquire 20% stake
items.description: SBI and the seven other banks had invested in the Bank as part of the Yes Bank Reconstruction Scheme in March 2020.

items.title: Sticky performance — Pidilite delivers stability in tough Q4
items.description: Underlying volume growth continues to remain strong

items.title: Navin Fluorine: Multiple agreements, new capacities strengthen outlook
items.description: The company could benefit from the China-plus-one theme in fluorine chemistry

items.title: Indo-Pak Ceasefire: What’s next for Indian equities?
items.description: Volatility may continue in the short term and it’s better to be watchful

items.title: Agri Picks Report May 12, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, Sowing of rabi crops in Telangana reached 7.99 million acres (1 acre = 0.4 hectares) as of Wednesday, up 18% from 6.77 million acres a year ago, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.title: Adani Power to supply 1500 MW thermal power to Uttar Pradesh; shares up 6%
items.description: Adani Power Share Price | The company will supply power at a highly competitive tariff of Rs 5.383 per unit from a greenfield 2x800 MW (1500 MW net) Ultra-supercritical power plant to be set up under the design, build, finance, own, and operate (DBFOO) model in the state.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Nifty near 24,700, Sensex surges 2,190 pts on Indo-Pak peace pact
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: BSE Limited, Hindustan Aeronautics, Sun Pharma, HDFC Bank, Tata Motors are among most active shares on the NSE. All the sectoral indices are trading in the green. BSE Midcap and smallcap indices up 3 percent each.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: Yes Bank, Swiggy, Dr Reddys Labs, Navin Fluorine, Bank of India, Manappuram Finance, ABB India, Puravankara in focus on 12 May
items.description: Stocks to Watch, 12 May: Stocks like Dr Reddy's Laboratories, Navin Fluorine International, Bank of India, Yes Bank, Swiggy, Manappuram Finance, ABB India, and Puravankara will be in focus on May 12.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: After remaining net buyers in the previous sixteen sessions, the Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) turned net sellers on May 9 as they offloaded equities of Rs 3,798 crore. On the other hand, Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) bought equities of Rs 7,277 crore on same day.

items.title: Asian stocks, US futures gain on China trade talks
items.description: Shares in Australia, Japan and South Korea advanced at the open, with the Topix index gaining for a 12th day for its longest winning streak since October 2017.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Tata Motors, Astra Microwave Products, UPL, Solar Industries, Max Financial Services, and others on May 12?
items.description: Rangebound trading is expected to continue in the upcoming sessions. Below are some short-term trading ideas to consider.

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stocks that moved the most on May 12
items.description: At close, Sensex was up nearly 3,000 points to settle at 82,429.90. Nifty meanwhile ended the session around 4 percent higher at 24,925.

items.title: Defence shares surge on India's resolute response to border escalation, DMGO's assurance of preparedness
items.description: The Nifty India Defence index closed with modest gains of about 0.7 percent, but select shares saw strong buying interest. The DGMOs' assurance of armed forces being prepared for future missions 'should the need arise' supported investor sentiment in this space.

items.title: Taking Stock: Best day in absolute terms as India-Pak ceasefire, US-China tariff cuts revive sentiment
items.description: With today's gain, investors' wealth increased by more than Rs 16 lakh crore, as the market capitalization of BSE-listed companies jumped to Rs 432.55 lakh crore, from Rs 416.40 lakh crore in the previous session.

items.title: Mid, smallcap indices surge over 4% on India-Pak ceasefire, Sino-US deal on trade
items.description: In the late afternoon trade, the Nifty Midcap 100 index was trading 55,416, while Nifty Smallcap 100 index was trading at 16,770

items.title: Coforge | Is it the right time to invest in this stock? | Stock of the day
items.description: Coforge has seen remarkable consistency in performance under its professional management in the past eight years. Will the next years get better with its recent acquisition and hunger for growth and razor-sharp focus on execution?

items.title: Buy Supreme Industries; target of Rs 4107: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services is bullish on Supreme Industries has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 4107 in its research report dated May 12, 2025.

items.title: BSE, MCX, other capital market shares soar up to 10% as risk-on sentiment returns following India-Pak truce
items.description: BSE shares jump 5% to hit all-time high as market regulator SEBI is likely to relax some F&O norms.

items.title: Buy SJS Enterprises; target of Rs 1406: LKP Research
items.description: LKP Research is bullish on SJS Enterprises has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1406 in its research report dated May 12, 2025.
